definition: variant of 賢慧|贤慧[xian2 hui4]
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
surname Hui
favor/benefit/to bestow/(literary) benevolence/(honorific)

sentences.english: Such a virtuous Shen Guanghui Sun Weidong is unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 这样贤惠的沈光蕙是孙维栋料想不到的。

sentences.english: I am a traditional Chinese lady, tender, virtuous, loving, enjoy life. Like travel, sports, nature, beastie.
sentences.chinese: 我是一位传统的中国女性，温柔贤惠，善解人意。

sentences.english: Whether there is another woman Xian-hui motherhood, but what is a child.
sentences.chinese: 女人不管再贤惠有母性，但骨子里都是一个孩子。

sentences.english: You are the virtuousest girl in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 在我心中，最贤惠的女孩是你。

sentences.english: My mother is a virtuous wife and good mother.
sentences.chinese: 我的母亲是一位贤惠的妻子和好母亲。

definition: (of a wife) wise and kind/perfect in her traditional roles
(of a woman) virtuous
a good wife and loving mother
to housekeep/housekeeping
educated and well-balanced (idiom)
to be good at understanding others (idiom)
(old) perfect wife/you, my beloved wife
(said of sb else's wife) a good wife
considerate (of other people's needs)
hardworking and thrifty in running one's household
ladylike
filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
to take care of one's family
good-looking and intelligent (idiom)
see 通情達理|通情达理[tong1 qing2 da2 li3]
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
